Package ej.microui.io

Class Summary
AlphaNumericDisplay An AlphaNumericDisplay object represents an implementation screen, and there is a display for each implementation screen.
AlphaNumericDisplayFont Represents a font that can be displayed on an AlphaNumericDisplay.

AlphaNumericDisplayFonts are never created by applications, but are rather retrieved from the implementation environment.
AudioOut The AudioOut class allows sounds to be played.

A tone is an integer between 0 and 127, which can be retrieved from its frequency with the following formula:

SEMITONE_CONST = 1/(ln(2^(1/12))) = 17.31234049066755
note = ln(freq/8.176)*SEMITONE_CONST
The musical note A = MIDI note 69 (0x45) = 440 Hz.

The available non-silent tone values are in range 0 <= tone <= 127.
Buttons A Buttons event generator is usually associated to a group of physical buttons and allow to generate events relating to them.

For a specified subset of buttons it holds the elapsed time since the last event occurrence for that button and supports the optional generation of click and double click events.
ComponentView ComponentView is an abstract class that represents a visible area.
CompositeView CompositeView is a container class of ComponentViews.
Display A Display object represents a pixelated screen in the platform, and there is a display for each such pixelated screen.
Displayable Displayable is an abstract class which defines the very objects that can be shown on a Display.
A Displayable object is built for a specific Display which can not be changed afterwards.
DisplayFont A DisplayFont defines how text is rendered on a Display.
DisplayFonts are never created by applications, but are rather retrieved from the implementation environment.

An application can get all available fonts with DisplayFont.getAllFonts(), or query for a particular font: in this case the implementation will return the most appropriate font matching the request.

The height gives the height of a line of text with the font.
ExplicitFlush An ExplicitFlush is a GraphicsContext where flushing data to the screen must be done explicitly by the application.
FlyingImage The FlyingImage class defines an image to be displayed at the top level in the rendering depth of a display.

A FlyingImage contains an Image.
Font A Font defines how text is rendered on a screen.

A Font is defined by one or more identifiers, a style and a descriptor.
GraphicsContext The GraphicsContext class offers basic drawing facilities, to render lines, rectangles, polygons, arcs and text.

GraphicsContext uses 24-bit RGB color.
Image An Image object holds graphical display data.
Keyboard A Keyboard event generator allows key combinations to generate a key code.
Keypad Keypad is a Keyboard that defines an event generator for 12-key keypads.
Leds This class is used to manage all LEDs available on the platform.
Pointer A Pointer event generator represents a pointing device that is usually associated to a group of physical buttons.
PointerButtons Deprecated.  
Screen A Screen represents an hardware screen with its characteristics: width, height, number of supported colors, backlight etc.
States A States event generator is usually associated to a group of physical devices holding a position (switch, rotary wheel encoder, ...) and allow to generate events relating to them.
View View is an abstract class which extends ComponentView.
Viewable Viewable is a Displayable subclass that contains a hierarchy of ComponentView for its rendering.
